app.title: Cloud Backup
app.chooseSetupType: Choose your setup type to get started.

setup.adminDescription: Configure AWS infrastructure, create bucket, and manage user accounts. Choose this if you're setting up the backup system for your organization.
setup.userDescription: Connect to an existing backup system using credentials provided by your administrator.

dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.selectProfile: Select a profile from the sidebar to view the dashboard.
dashboard.deleteWarning: This operation will delete {{count}} files from the cloud. This action cannot be undone.
dashboard.syncDeleteConfirmation: This sync operation will delete {{count}} files from the cloud. Are you sure you want to continue?

settings.title: Settings
settings.copyModeDescription: Safe mode that only adds new files. Never deletes from cloud.
settings.syncModeDescription: Makes cloud exactly match local. May delete files. Requires confirmation.
settings.timeFormat: Enter time in 24-hour format: 0-23 hours, 0-59 minutes (e.g., 14:30 for 2:30 PM, 22:45 for 10:45 PM)
settings.selectProfileSettings: Select a profile from the sidebar to view settings.
settings.selectFoldersDescription: Select the folders you want to backup to the cloud.
settings.advancedDescription: Configure rclone flags and advanced options.

cloudBrowser.title: Cloud Browser
cloudBrowser.browseCloudFiles: Browse and restore files from your cloud backup.
cloudBrowser.selectProfileBrowse: Select a profile from the sidebar to browse cloud files.

userManagement.title: User Management
userManagement.manageEmployeeAccounts: Manage employee backup accounts and generate rclone configurations.

adminSetup.title: Admin Setup
adminSetup.awsCredentialsDescription: Configure your AWS access credentials for admin operations
adminSetup.credentialsConfigured: AWS credentials are configured and validated
adminSetup.adminCredentialsInfo: You need AWS credentials with administrative permissions to create S3 buckets, IAM users, and policies. These credentials will be used to set up the backup infrastructure for your organization.
adminSetup.securityNote1: Your credentials are stored securely using AWS CLI configuration
adminSetup.securityNote2: We recommend using IAM credentials with only the necessary permissions
adminSetup.securityNote3: Consider enabling MFA on your AWS account for additional security
adminSetup.infrastructureDescription: Configure your S3 bucket and storage settings
adminSetup.employeeSetupDescription: Add employees who will have backup access
adminSetup.employeeInfo: Each employee will get their own IAM user with access only to their folder in the bucket.
adminSetup.reviewDescription: Review your configuration and create the infrastructure
adminSetup.importantNote: This will create AWS resources that may incur costs. The setup will create IAM users, policies, and configure your S3 bucket.

userSetup.title: User Setup
userSetup.profileNameDescription: Give your backup profile a name
userSetup.profileNameHelp: Choose a descriptive name for your backup configuration.
userSetup.awsCredentialsDescription: Enter the credentials provided by your administrator
userSetup.credentialsInfo: Your administrator should have provided you with AWS credentials and bucket information. If you don't have these, please contact your admin.
userSetup.usernameHelp: This should match the username your admin created for you.
userSetup.rcloneDescription: Configure the rclone tool for file synchronization
userSetup.sourceFoldersDescription: Select the folders you want to backup
userSetup.copyModeInfo: Only copies new and changed files. Never deletes files from the cloud.
